Articles.Content:
Hi all. It\'s my first engine made from real prototype.

NK-33 used in Soviet lunar program, on the first stage of N1F. After 20 years this engines were bought by americans for using on Antares-2 after some modifications. This engine have not gimbaling, pitch and yaw on N1 controlled by dismatching thrust on opposite standing engines. Maybe, I\'ll make NK-33-1, modified version with gimbaling and increased thrust.

I made simplified version, and I have two reasons for this:

1. There are too lot of poly\'s even in this simplified model.

2. My knowledge of 3ds max is very modest.

Nice model; how many polygons does that have, now?

Also, whats the plan on mounting it, just letting the piping clip into the tank above it?

It has 12 700 polys, I\'ve optimized it from 25 000 polys. Optimising continues

I don\'t know how it mounted on real N1. And I don\'t know how to mount it, maybe like you said. I\'ve added some details, new pictures will be soon. It will be difficult for me to texture it good, because I don\'t know modifier Unwrap UVW very well.

Optimized it down to 5600 poly\'s. WIN.

I\'ve already finished engine, I\'ll upload it soon.

My next engine will be RD-170, most powerful liquid fuel engine in the world. Then I\'ll make RD-180.

Wow, that engine looks spectacular! If you need any pointers on unwrapping, just let me know. I\'ve been fighting my way thru the 3ds UV system for a while now.

I hope optimizing didn\'t hurt that silhouette too much, because it looks great the way you\'re showing it off.

Also wow, That RD-170 is gonna be rough to get done inside the usual polycount limits for this game.

You might want to look into texturing as a way to simulate more detail with fewer polys? Especially with those pipes and radial clams that are almost flush with the engine nozzle, you could just make them a surface bump and paint in some shading to make it look like it\'s a pipe?
, my favourite engine, looks great. But probably someone must to create extra fuel tank for it, the top side can be a problem.

Might make sense to attach a circular 'mount' to the engine, so it can be easily combined with existing fuel tanks?

Either that or a series of 'adapters' in various sizes to stack between the engine and the fuel tanks? You could put a little fuel in the adapters too, so they aren\'t wasted space.

Adapters? Hm... I can make that. I will make it soon, a few days later.

I also made RD-170 and RD-180 engines. RD-170 is most powerful liquid fuel engine in the world, RD-180 is cutted version of RD-170. RD-170 used in the first stage of 'Energia', RD-180 used on the first stage of Atlas-IIA(Atlas-III).

RD-180 used on the first stage of Atlas-IIA(Atlas-III).

Even on the Atlas V
